FuncDef:
The radius-client packet dscp command sets a DSCP value for RADIUS packets sent from the BRAS to a RADIUS proxy.
The undo radius-client packet dscp command restores the default setting.
By default, the DSCP value for RADIUS packets sent from the BRAS to a RADIUS proxy is 32.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a DSCP value for RADIUS packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent RADIUS packet loss during network congestion, run the radius-client packet dscp command to increase the DSCP value for RADIUS packets sent from the BRAS to a RADIUS proxy.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
